attributes.action: recognise that arresting Charlie Chaplian impersonators outside parliament is very silly indeed.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I'm sure we all read with interest this weekend about the parliamentary exclusion zone legislation being used to arrest a lone protestor amusingly, yet silently dressed as Charlie Chaplain. This was the latest in a line of arrests - often by armed police - of people having the audacity to protest peacefully outside the home of government without permission.

All we, the undersigned, want is Tony Blair to recognise that the new legislation is not being used wisely and has the potential to make London's  law enforcers look a tad foolish.

rejection.details: Your petition needs to have a clear call-to-action as its title
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
